Ratings.comment: I did my graduate degree (master's) under this professor and would not recommend anyone to do the same. She has no idea about the direction of research and changes research projects based on wherever she can find her funding from which simply proves she is not passionate about what she is doing.

I'm giving this professor a bad rating, and not because she gave me a B while I had straight As in every other single class during my Masters program, but due to the fact that she was really a bad lecturer who gave an impossible final with few questions that nobody in the class could solve. Avoid at all cost.
Pathetic! I am going to drop the class
Though she has no interest in taking class and teaching, I got a good recommendation. Breeze!

She is incomprehensible and isn't able to solve her own assignment questions if you catch her off guard. She doesn't even seem to care less for teaching. You will be asked to make presentations in the class which I guess saves her from teaching.

This prof is least interested in teaching but when it comes to setting exam paper she want to show that she is more smarter than others. Homeworks are tough and she'll ask her grad students to help you rather than doing herself. I don't think she cares about this class as she is full professor. Even though I got an A-, I wouldn't recommend anyone.

Professor Vasques himself is hilarious and a great professor. I liked the class okay but my biggest gripe was the moderate amount of abstract math in the homework. I just felt like I didn't get much out of it as I liked to learn mostly just conceptual details. If you're interested in Nuclear engineering or maybe a Nuke minor definitely take it.

This class was interesting and a lot of fun, especially the tour of the reactor on campus. There are five homeworks, which he will help you with after class or during office hours. Then there are two midterms that are take home. No finals.

Dr. Vasques was an unbelievable professor. Strived to see his students succeed. Very accommodating, very available to help students with homework and specifically guide them. There every step of the way, very approachable, effectively communicated course material. Would definitely recommend him and this course. Great intro into the Nuclear field!
